sentences.en: a moderate degree of success
sentences.cn: 一定程度上的成功

sentences.en: a moderate politician
sentences.cn: 温和派政治家

sentences.en: a moderate smoker
sentences.cn: 吸烟有节制的人

sentences.en: a student of moderate ability
sentences.cn: 能力一般的学生

sentences.en: Bake the pie for 30 minutes in a moderate oven.
sentences.cn: 馅饼用中火烘烤30分钟。

sentences.en: Contrary to popular belief, moderate exercise actually decreases your appetite.
sentences.cn: 与通常的看法相反，适度的运动事实上会降低食欲。

sentences.en: Even moderate amounts of alcohol can be dangerous.
sentences.cn: 喝酒即使不多也会有危险。

sentences.en: Futures prices recovered from sharp early declines to end with moderate losses.
sentences.cn: 期货价格在早盘深幅下跌后出现反弹，收盘时未见严重损失。

sentences.en: He became the official mouthpiece of the moderate leadership.
sentences.cn: 他成为温和派领导人的官方代言人.

sentences.en: He could be depended on to take a moderate position on most of the key issues.
sentences.cn: 他应该会在大部分关键问题上采取中间立场。

sentences.en: He holds moderate opinions.
sentences.cn: 他持稳健的见解.

sentences.en: He is moderate in drinking.
sentences.cn: 他饮酒适度.

sentences.en: He learnt to moderate his anger.
sentences.cn: 他学会了克制自己的怒火。

sentences.en: Moderate exercise will benefit you.
sentences.cn: 适当的锻炼对你有好处.

sentences.en: Moderate exercise, such as walking, is recommended.
sentences.cn: 建议适度锻炼，比如散步。

sentences.en: moderate to strong winds
sentences.cn: 中到大风

sentences.en: Most drugs offer either no real improvement or, at best, only moderate improvements.
sentences.cn: 大多数药物要么不能使病情真正好转，要么最多只能带来轻微的改善。

sentences.en: students of moderate ability
sentences.cn: 能力一般的学生

sentences.en: The chest X - rays showed moderate enlargement of the heart.
sentences.cn: 胸部 X 光片显示出心脏稍有扩大.

sentences.en: The chops should be cooked over moderate heat to prevent excessive charring.
sentences.cn: 肉块应该用文火烹煮，以免烧过了头。

sentences.en: The hotel is moderate in its charges.
sentences.cn: 这家旅店收费适当.

sentences.en: the more moderate members of the party
sentences.cn: 党内观点较为温和的党员

sentences.en: The students moderated their demands.
sentences.cn: 学生们降低了要求。

sentences.en: The wind is moderate today.
sentences.cn: 今天的风很柔和.

sentences.en: There were three moderate climbs to just below the 450 feet contour.
sentences.cn: 刚好在450英尺的等高线之下有3个缓坡。

sentences.en: They are hoping that once in office he can be persuaded to moderate his views.
sentences.cn: 他们希望他一上台后就能他说服，使他的观点变得温和些。

sentences.en: You should moderate your language when children are present.
sentences.cn: 在孩子面前,你说话应该有节制.

words.tran_cn: 适度地；中庸地；有节制地
指该讨论区设有信件区管理人
适度；温和；暖和（moderate的名词形式）
[核] 慢化剂；仲裁人；调解人；缓和剂
稳健的，温和的；适度的，中等的；有节制的

trans.tran_cn: 有节制的，稳健的，温和的，适度的，中等的，<美俚>慢吞吞的
trans.tran_en: not very large or very small, very hot or very cold, very fast or very slow etc

trans.tran_cn: 持温和观点者（尤指政见）
trans.tran_en: someone whose opinions or beliefs, especially about politics, are not extreme and are considered reasonable by most people
If you moderate something or if it moderates, it becomes less extreme or violent and easier to deal with or accept
